Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

This exceptional opportunity is a part of the Mechanical Systems Engineering, Fabrication, and Test Division, which is actively involved in research, technology advancement, and the creation of cutting-edge mechanical, thermal, propulsion, and electronic packaging systems. Our expertise covers a wide spectrum of mechanical disciplines and is employed from the initial architectural concept phase through to operational stages.

As an Engineering Intern, you will be an integral member of JPL's Mechanical Fabrication and Test Section. This section is responsible for maintaining technical support facilities and resources essential for fabricating, assembling, and testing electro-mechanical developmental and flight hardware. The Section is dedicated to advancing equipment and technologies that enrich our fabrication and environmental testing capabilities for both present and future missions. In this role, you will join the Materials Development and Additive Manufacturing group to:

  • Conduct hands-on experiments within a laboratory setting.
  • Conceptualize, construct, and evaluate advanced thermal management technologies leveraging metal additive manufacturing techniques.
  • Analyze the microstructure and mechanical properties of various materials.

Qualifications:

  • Must be currently enrolled at least half-time at a local accredited college or university pursuing a Bachelor's degree or Graduate degree in Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Chemistry, Civil Engineering, Material/Science, Physics, Robotics, Structural Engineering, or related technical discipline
  • Must be available to work part time during the school year 8 to 30 hours
  • Minimum GPA 3.0/4.0
  • Coursework providing an understanding and application of standard principles, theories, concepts and techniques in mechanical and thermal systems, materials engineering, experimental design and laboratory/experimental practices
  • General knowledge of applicable industry and/or academic practices and standards in mechanical design
  • Willingness and flexibility to receive direction and mentoring from project leadership

What would help:

  • Be a self-starter and task-oriented team player with strong customer service skills and excellent interpersonal, organizational, communication, and planning skills
  • Knowledge of working fluids for 300-800 K heat pipes
  • Experience with thermal testing
  • Experience in building and testing custom heat pipes
  • Experience with SolidWorks or NX mechanical design software tools
  • Experience with Python, MATLAB, or LabView languages

The typical hourly rate for this job in Pasadena, California depending on education level is $19 as a freshman, $22 as a sophomore, $26 as a junior, $29 as a senior

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
